Stacey Bernadette Mariash and Rémy Adrien Georges Bertin were married last evening at the Central Park Boathouse in New York. Jonathan Hefter, a Universal Life minister, officiated.
The bride, 28, is an architectural designer at 1100 Architect in New York. She graduated from Pratt Institute.

She is a daughter of Dianne DeWitt of New York and Robert Mariash of Scottsdale, Ariz., and a stepdaughter of Dianne Mariash and of Eugene DeWitt. The bride's father and stepmother are commercial real estate developers in Scottsdale. Her mother and stepfather work in New York, where she is an account manager at Verizon, and he is the owner of DeWitt Media Strategies, an agency that buys advertising.
The bridegroom, 30, is a senior designer at Richard Meier & Partners Architects in New York. He graduated from the University of Virginia and received a master's degree in architecture from Yale.

He is the son of Brenda Bertin of Mont St.-Hilaire, Quebec, and the late Georges Bertin. His mother manufactures ceramic floor and wall tiles in St.-Mathieu de Beloeil, Quebec. His father was an aeronautics engineer at Grumman Aerospace in Bethpage, N.Y.
